title: getting notified when you get reported.
body:
I think that If riot notified people each time they got a report, it would be much more effective to counter toxic behavior. So in the current system, you get reported maybe 3 games of being toxic, and then you get a punishment and they tell you what you did wrong. it's fine but I think that it's easy for a person to play three games in a row and be toxic without really realizing that they are harassing others and that it could result in a punishment. So if they got a message that they were reported, they would be able to keep themselves in check and not harass people in the next games, preventing them from being punished in the first place.

What are your thoughts? Would this be useful to prevent players from getting punished? Do you even want to help toxic players prevent their punishments? leave a comment below!

Edit: shout out yo YerroFever for his idea, that instead of getting notified when you get reported, you get notified about the game 1 and or game 2 instead of never being notified and suddenly getting punished for GAME 1, GAME 2, GAME 3
if they told you about GAME 1 and GAME 2, it would help you correct your ways before being punished.

replies.body: You used to get a notification if you were reported too frequently, but it was removed because it felt bad for players whether they actually did something wrong or not because you can get reported a lot for behavior that isn't punishable, or reported for no reason at all. I thought it was a useful method to get people to tone it down before they needed to be punished, but Riot doesn't seem to agree (Riot Tantram stated that was his personal opinion on the matter at least).
now that you mention it I do remember they did give a notification, yeah I think it would only be a benefit.

I think it's unfortunate that it was entirely removed, as I personally benefited from it when I started the game by being warned early that the behavior I was used to from other games wasn't tolerated here. I never had to be punished for me to improve how I treated others and react to negativity in the game.

It were indeed often bullshit  moments since the reports were just reports instead of actual accepted report by the system. For example: Played  a bit on aram with a friend who is a total noob so the only thing i typed was hi team , some  tips in flemish for him and in the first game at some rages to just chill because he was new and still learning. First game toxic premade slandered us in allchat and got the other team to also report us (i gave to few fucks about an aram game to defend myself) , couple of games later we played vs a 5 man premade that just found it fun to all report the guy who had smashed them (was really on fire that game). After that i got a warning for harrasment while i litterally hadnt typed a word more than what i previously mentionned for the last 5 à 6 games. A solution t remedy this would be to only send warnings for genuin reports but then you just get a lot of people who game the system instead of actually reforming.       
So yeah great idea on paper, doesnt work live.

I'd say if you got the same report twice in two different games to get a notifcation, so there wouldn't be 4 man spamming or something.

Though I definitely see where they're coming from with people feeling bad over things that might not even lead to consequences.

i'm speaking from my own experience.

I got my first account perma banned (I've been playing League since the very first day of the Open Beta) due to the classic "Be the hero for too long and you'll end up being the villain". I was a very nice guy, but after the introduction of the worst feature ever (Tribunal) a lot of cancerous players dedicated their lives to troll others and get them banned.

Sadly I fell far to many times on their clutches, I became toxic af, gotta admit I stopped playing right after my perma ban. Came back like 1 year later, and started to play again the way I was before, like a chill dude. Well, then the "notifications" were introduced and I became toxic again, I was reported for verbal abuse and stuff like that for trying to teach others how to play, for calling shots, etc.

Every single time I played good, carried etc without being toxic, I remember getting hella pissed whenever I got a notification saying I was reported, or when I was chat restricted, I was like "WTF? Are you for real?" Then I started to get tilted and adopted a troll behavior all that because I got discouraged due to people being able to report you for whatever reason, even for just being good at the game.

Well, I stopped playing again and came back, and trust me I've learned the hard way that, having those features did more harm than anything. So I went back to my old self, of course I get mad if we are losing because of trolls, but I learned that even when people is trolling, if you don't become negative about it, nothing happens. Being negative will always affect you, and only you.
The culture of blatantly false reports because of trolling premades would just make this a system to amplify the tilt from that.

No that's pointless. I'm a nice person who doesn't flame and I get reported every other game. I imagine many others are in the same situation.

The only way that would work would be to have the system itself warn you. You know how the system can automatically punish you? Have it warn you too, if what you did wasn't really enough for a punishment but was enough for the system to notice.

I think if you got notified each time you got reported, then people could use that as a harassment tool and also ramp up the number of fake reports to actually filter through.

I think it's better to be notified when you've been found guilty of an infraction.

EDIT:

And by this I mean, instead of seeing "GAME 1" "GAME 2" "GAME 3" in your punishment, you are on notice when you hit game 1, and game 2, and game 3 significantly closer to when you actually harassed someone. Then when someone keeps up their behavior, they've gotten prior notice to the punishment and they'll be less surprised when they're punished.

The biggest complaint I've seen on the forums is that people feel blindisided by the punishment system because it takes so long for punishments to be handed out.

yeah that's kind of the same thing but yeah, they take the game 1 that they've already reviewed and tell you that you're close to being punished. so you don't even escalate to a game 2 or game 3, and if you do, well you knew before you got punished at least and not after you get punished
